**Title:** "The Everyday Device"

**Plot Summary:**
In this gripping thriller, Sam is a brilliant but reclusive engineer who works in a small tech company. One day, he stumbles upon a mysterious blueprint hidden within an old book at a thrift store. The blueprint outlines a device that can manipulate reality on a small scale using only common household items. Intrigued and slightly paranoid, Sam decides to recreate the device in his garage.

As he begins assembling the device, strange occurrences start happening around him. Objects move on their own, time seems to warp, and people he encounters become increasingly suspicious and hostile. Sam soon realizes that the device has a mind of its own and could be dangerous if not controlled properly.

The story takes a turn when Sam discovers that the blueprint was left behind by a former colleague who disappeared under mysterious circumstances years ago. As Sam delves deeper into the mystery, he uncovers a conspiracy involving corporate espionage, government secrets, and even a shadowy organization that will stop at nothing to keep the device out of the wrong hands.

Sam must race against time to understand the full extent of the device's capabilities and prevent it from falling into the wrong hands while also trying to stay alive. Along the way, he forms an unlikely alliance with a journalist who is investigating similar phenomena and together they unravel a web of intrigue that spans across continents.

This novel combines elements of science fiction and psychological thriller, with a protagonist named Sam who is central to the plot. The everyday objects used in the device add a layer of realism and intrigue, making the story both believable and thrilling.
